phrases: I do not regret anything at all!
coming in like a storm from a completely different direction.
Even if it takes the rest of my life, I will pay you back.
It is the cherries that Kiriyama brought over.
I am not crazy about fruit.
Maybe we should take a bath.
Although it is a bit early...
So, Hina, do you want to try playing?
W-Will you go easy on me?
Then would you take it upstairs?
I want to play some more...
I am going to give Momo her bath.
*Kawamoto House's bath changing room is the living room.
I want to play with Rei.
Are you sure that is all you need?
Apparently the first time in Hina's room...
Then I might be able to win!
Why are not I going first?
I thought you were going easy on me.
There is a rule that with handicap shogi, the player who is short of pieces goes first.
Hey, yo, pineapple, lalala, a strange magical fruit...
I will just play with two pieces, the king and a gold general!
Why am I so bad at this?
You are taking my Pawn at 5-5?
If anything, the chairman is skilled at making his opponents look good and enjoy themselves.
Mr. Yokomizo takes the time to amuse and teach even oddball players.
Imagine what your opponent is thinking and what they want to do.
Then get close to their feelings.
In the waiting room of his first shogi event
Well, calm down, and let us take it easy.
I think I am starting to get the hang of it, so I should be okay for the next one.
I am no match for her!
This middle school student is consoling me again!
What is the point of coming here to console her if she is the one consoling you, Rei Kiriyama?
And suddenly I felt a lump in my throat.
Over the years, how often has this girl smiled
and been considerate of other people's feelings like this?
A little bit at a time is fine.
About what is happening at school...
Right now, I guess this is what it is like.
Like everyone is looking from afar.
Hina thought and thought, slowly sharing bits and pieces with me.
Our groups are set up by order of name,
but at lunch, I can tell that everyone gets so stiff.
They hardly ever look at me.
It is like only my group is at a wake.
And then the silence is suddenly broken by the loud laughter of the girls who bullied Chiho.
It is like there is an invisible hierarchy within our class.
And your ranking decides how loud you can laugh
or how much freedom you are allowed in the classroom.
That is the atmosphere of Hina's class.
I am sure this is a story that everyone has experienced at one time or another.
There should not even be such a thing.
It is been there all the time.
When and how is that decided?
Even though we are all just the same middle school students.
Even though we are all just the same human beings.
Is that what she really said?
if things get difficult, let us just play catch.
If you want more people, I could call my baseball team buddies to join in.
Kiriyama came over to my house yesterday to coach us while playing.
For the Silver at 4-3, you go with Pawn at 3-4.
Professional shogi players are so amazing.
That is why you are a professional.
Well, it is a surprise tactic.
Grandpa's been staying in bed recently, but he was up and about for this.
Invite me over again for curry.
Last time Dad and Grandpa were hogging Kiriyama, so I could not really to talk to him.
Just one more win and I will be in the Kishousen preliminary semifinals!
Things are looking up this month!
At the moment, I have got two consecutive wins for rank-deciding matches.
I am still in the running for Kishousen, the Lion King Tournament,
I would like to win the Lion King Tournament.
If I can win in group five and participate in the challenger tournament...
But with the Newcomer Tournament, prize money aside,
I want to win one more match, get to the finals, and build up momentum.
All right, I need to practice.
I am not going to lose!
I will become the Newcomer King!
I could not finish eating everything.
Is this what they call a stomach ache?
Why did not you show up?
Uh, I think we were in the same class first year.
You want to play catch too?
They tossed my glove on the ground and ran off.
The one who changed schools was Chiho Sakura, right?
During the overnight field trip in second year,
the wind blew my bento box over and sand got all over my food.
Then she gave me half of her bento.
At the time, I thought that anyone who shared their own food was a good person.
So let us play catch anytime.
I kind of feel like it is a good idea to show them that there are allies too.
I did not think that far ahead.
Do not take it like that!
I am going to keep playing catch.
And Takahashi seems to remember Chiho.
So I can talk about her, and that makes me really happy.
Nobody talks about Chiho in class anymore,
so it is like she was never there from the beginning.
Rei, thank you for always listening to me.
You are always asking me what I want to do.
I do not know what I want to do...
What do I want to do?
I want to yell Idiots! and punch them!
I want to beat the crap out of them!
I want to do to them what they did to Chiho!
And then I want them to realize what they did!
Chiho has not got back to school, even here.
Right now she is in rehab with a counselor at a place called Heart Care Center.
Chiho would like to write to you, but...
Even if I make them apologize...
I do not think Chiho would ever want to see their faces!
HINATA KAWAMOTO LOVES GUYS PERVERTED GIRL BITCH IDIOT
There is one thing that I realized.
HINATA KAWAMOTO LOVES GUYS PERVERTED GIRL BITCH IDIOT
M-Ms. Kawamoto, what is the meaning of this?
I am not the one who wrote it.
I think you are misreading it, Ms. Kawamoto.
You should not turn every situation into a bad one.
It was already written on the board when I came in this morning.
A-Anyway, let us begin the lesson.
Ms. Kawamoto, please see me in the faculty room after class.
Let us have a good game.
She is not only in pain.
In fact, she is seething from the pit of her stomach.
No, do not look at me!
Sis, get me a bath towel!
We finally made it to this point!
I am the only one who can go from our family.
Maybe I should have bought ice cream instead.
